Add catalog cache-stats CLI command
description:
Implement a CLI command that displays comprehensive cache statistics including total size, entry count, cache directory, and per-dataset breakdown with freshness status.

Current State:
- ✅ FileCache.size() exists
- ✅ FileCache.list_all_keys() exists  
- ✅ Catalog.cache_size(name) exists
- ✅ _format_size() helper exists
- ❌ No catalog cache-stats command

Proposed Behavior:
```bash
$ catalog cache-stats
Total cache size: 2.3 GB
Total entries: 47
Cache directory: ./data

Per-dataset breakdown:
  customers: 125 MB (fresh)
  orders: 890 MB (stale)
  products: 1.2 GB (fresh)
  ...
```

Value: High - Essential for monitoring cache usage and debugging

title: Implement cache_stats() CLI command
description:
Add cache_stats() function to CLI that displays cache statistics.

Subtasks:
1. Add cache_stats() function to CLI (cli/main.py)
   - Register as @app.command("cache-stats")
   - Add --catalog option (consistent with other commands)
   - Use load_catalog_context() for catalog loading

2. Calculate total cache size
   - Call catalog._cache.size() for total bytes
   - Format with _format_size()
   - Handle empty cache (0 bytes)

3. Calculate total entry count
   - Call catalog._cache.list_all_keys()
   - Count returned keys
   - Handle empty cache (0 entries)

4. Display cache directory path
   - Get catalog._cache.cache_dir
   - Show as relative path if possible

5. Calculate per-dataset breakdown
   - Iterate through all datasets in catalog(s)
   - For each dataset: call catalog.cache_size(name)
   - Check freshness: catalog.is_stale(name) → "fresh" or "stale"
   - Handle missing datasets (not cached) → show 0 size or skip

6. Format output
   - Use typer.echo() for plain text output (consistent with other commands)
   - Structure: total stats, then per-dataset list
   - Format: dataset_name: size (status)

7. Handle edge cases
   - Empty cache → show "Total cache size: 0 B", "Total entries: 0"
   - No datasets → show appropriate message
   - Catalog filtering → respect --catalog flag

TRA: UseCase.CacheStats
Tier: 1 (fast)

description: CLI fetch --as-of flag is implemented but has no integration tests in test_cli.py. Core functionality is tested (TestFetchAsOf in test_catalog.py), but CLI integration tests are missing. Location: tests/unit/test_cli.py:191 (TestCatalogFetch class)

title: VERSION-001: catalog.versions(name, limit=10) feature already implemented
description: catalog.versions(name, limit=10) feature already implemented. Location: src/datacachalog/core/services.py:401-419, src/datacachalog/cli/main.py:466-540

title: Add catalog info command for detailed dataset inspection
Add list_all_keys method to CachePort protocol
description: Extend CachePort protocol with list_all_keys() method to enumerate all cache entries. This is needed for the clean command to identify orphaned cache files.

title: Rich Table Formatting for List/Status Commands
description: Replace plain text output with Rich tables for list and status commands to improve readability with columns, colors, and alignment.

title: ⚡ Add catalog clean command to remove orphaned cache files
CLI push command for catalog
description: Implement catalog push CLI command. Catalog.push() exists but no CLI wrapper. Part of Phase 4: Write Support and Phase 8: CLI.

title: Add tier markers to TestPush test methods
description: TestPush class methods are missing @pytest.mark.tier() markers. Should follow pattern of other test classes with @pytest.mark.tier(1) for fast unit tests. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog_push.py

title: Add property-based test for push roundtrip
description: Push should maintain roundtrip property: push(file) then fetch() returns same content. Consider adding hypothesis-based property test to verify this invariant. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog_push.py

title: Add TRA marker to TestCatalogFetch class
description: TestCatalogFetch class missing @pytest.mark.tra() anchor. Should have TRA marker like @pytest.mark.tra('UseCase.Fetch') or similar. Location: tests/unit/test_cli.py:191

title: Implement catalog.fetch(name, version_id=str) - fetch specific version (escape hatch)
description: Implement catalog.fetch(name, version_id=str) to fetch a specific version by its version_id. This is an escape hatch for direct version access and is part of Phase 10: S3 Version Tracking.

title: FETCH-001: Tests for catalog.fetch(as_of=datetime) lack @pytest.mark.tra anchors
description: Tests for catalog.fetch(as_of=datetime) lack @pytest.mark.tra anchors - tests use @pytest.mark.core but no TRA namespace anchors. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1647-1846

title: Add CLI tests for catalog push command
description: Missing CLI tests for catalog push command - need TestCatalogPush class with @pytest.mark.cli and @pytest.mark.tra("UseCase.Push"). Location: tests/unit/test_cli.py (missing)
